source.content: <doc> <a c="bananas"/> <a c="apples"/> <a c="oranges"/> <a c="grapefruit"/> <a c="lemons"/> <a c="tangerines"/> </doc>

test-case.name: function-0602

test-case.name: function-0701
test-case.description: XSLT stylesheet to perform a knight's tour of the chessboard. Author: Michael H. Kay Date: 15 November 2002 This version modified to use XSLT 2.0 and XPath 2.0, with sequences and functions. Type declarations added in Nov 2002 version. This stylesheet can be run using any XML file as a dummy source document. There is an optional parameter, start, which can be set to any square on the chessboard, e.g. a3 or h5. By default the tour starts at a1. The output is an HTML display of the completed tour. Internally, the following data representations are used: * A square on the chessboard: represented as a number in the range 0 to 63 * A state of the chessboard: a sequence of 64 integers, each containing a move number. A square that has not been visited yet is represented by a zero. * A set of possible moves: represented as a sequence of integers, * each integer representing the number of the destination square start-column is an integer in the range 0-7 start-row is an integer in the range 0-7, with zero at the top This template controls the processing. It does not access the source document.

modified.change: Declared serialization requirement

test-case.name: function-0901
test-case.description: A user-supplied test that once revealed a bug

test-case.description: Test whether function evaluation is pipelined. This test will return -100 if evaluation is pipelined, or throw a divide-by-zero error if not

test-case.description: Test numeric promotion of function result

test-case.description: derivative of func39 to test progressive reading of a closure

result.assert-xml: <out><x value="1"/><x value="4"/><x value="9"/><x value="16"/><x value="25"/><x value="36"/><x value="49"/><x value="64"/><x value="81"/><x value="100"/></out>

test-case.name: function-1014
test-case.description: One of many tests from Dimitre Novatchev's FXSL library. Tests FXSL max() function. Exercises recursion including tail call optimization <xsl:message> $pList: '<xsl:copy-of select="$pList"/>' </xsl:message>

test-case.description: Test that all functions defined in the F+O 3.0 specification are implemented. Note: update the source document from time to time with the latest draft spec

Changed test assertion to pass catalog-004

test-case.name: function-1902
test-case.description: Test that all functions defined in the F+O 3.0 specification are NOT implemented in a 2.0 processor. Note: call function-2001-generate.xsl (without arguments) from time to time if the RECs are updated

modified.change: Removed whitespace
Update results for renamed functions; output only the discrepancies to make results comparison easier
Changed the auto-generation of this test, it is now dependent on actual XHTML spec, and updated the set of functions it tests
Changed test assertion to pass catalog-004
Bug 20843: Updated autogen xslt to exclude xslt30 functions, updated test to create more useful output, added output comparison file.
changed XSLT file and test to have version 2.0
